pageContext.claim: “We have $100 billion trade deficit with Mexico and that doesn't include all the drugs that are pouring in because we have no wall.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump often says the U.S. has a trade deficit with Mexico of $100 billion, but his number is way off. According to the Office of the U.S. Trade Representative, the U.S. had a trade deficit of $64.1 billion with Mexico in 2017, counting goods and services. Drugs entering through Mexico in many cases get smuggled through U.S. ports of entry or via underground tunnels, not "because we have no wall."
